list: Please complete this voluntary questionnaire for {{respondent.ru_name}}.
If this business is part of an enterprise group, please answer all questions for this business in the UK only.
Do not include results for subsidiaries or parent enterprises.

Innovation, for the purpose of this survey, is defined as new or significantly improved goods or services as well as processes used to produce or supply all goods or services that {{ respondent.ru_name }} has introduced, regardless of their origin.
These innovations may be new to {{ respondent.ru_name }} or new to the market
Investments for future innovation and changes that {{ respondent.ru_name }} has introduced at a strategic level (in organisation and practices) are also covered

body.title: You will be asked to provide information for the business, including:

list: business strategy and practices
innovation investment
goods, services, and process innovation
factors deemed important when deciding to initiate or terminate innovation
public financial support for innovation
turnover and exports
skills and employment

content.description: If actual figures are not available, please provide informed estimates.

options.label: UK regional within approximately 100 miles of this business
options.value: UK regional within approximately 100 miles of this business

questions.title: In which geographic markets did {{respondent.ru_name}} sell goods and/or services?

answers.label: Turnover increased by at least 10% due to merger with another business or part of it
Turnover decreased by at least 10% due to merger with another business or part of it

questions.title: Did any of the following significant events or changes occur to {{respondent.ru_name}}?

blocks.title: General Business Information
blocks.description:
You have successfully completed this section

The next section covers changes in business strategy and practices, for example, implementing changes to marketing concepts or strategies.

answers.description: For example first use of supply chain management, business re-engineering, knowledge management, lean production or quality management
answers.label: New business practices for organising procedures

answers.description: For example first use of a new system of employee responsibilities, team work, decentralisation, integration or de-integration of departments or education / training systems
answers.label: New methods of organising work responsibilities and decision making

answers.description: For example first use of alliances, partnerships, outsourcing or subcontracting
answers.label: New methods of organising external relationships with other firms or public institutions

answers.description: For example a marketing concept or strategy that differs significantly from your enterprise’s existing marketing methods and which has not been used before
answers.label: Implementation of significant  changes to marketing concepts or strategies.

content.title: Include:
list: all new and significantly improved forms of organisation, business structures or practices aimed at raising internal efficiency or the effectiveness of approaching markets and customers.
changes that have been implemented during the 3 year period

content.title: Exclude:
list: ongoing changes

questions.title: Did {{respondent.ru_name}} make changes in the following areas?

blocks.title: Business Strategy & Practices
blocks.description:
You have successfully completed this section

The next section covers investments in innovation.

You will be asked to provide figures for expenditure on innovation activities in the calendar year 2016.

content.title: Definition of ‘internal Research and Development’:
list: Creative work undertaken within your business that increases knowledge for developing new and improved goods or services and processes.

questions.title: Did {{respondent.ru_name}} invest in internal Research and Development for the purposes of current or future innovation?
In which of the following years did {{respondent.ru_name}} invest in internal Research & Development?

answers.description: Round to the nearest thousand pounds, for example enter £1,702,800 as 1703000
answers.label: Total internal Research and Development

content.title: Include:
list: Internal costs and purchases from outside the business

questions.title: Please estimate the amount of expenditure on internal Research & Development the calendar year 2016 only?

content.title: Include:
list: Creative work undertaken  by companies, including other businesses within your group, or by public or private research organisations and purchased by your business

questions.title: Did {{respondent.ru_name}} invest in the acquisition of Research and Development for the purposes of current or future innovation?

answers.description: Round to the nearest thousand pounds, for example enter £1,702,800 as 1703000
answers.label: Total acquisition of Research and Development

content.title: Include:
list: Internal costs and purchases from outside the business

questions.title: Please estimate the amount of expenditure on acquisition of Research & Development in the calendar year 2016 only?
Did {{respondent.ru_name}} invest in acquisition of advanced machinery, equipment or software for the purposes of current or future innovation?
Which of the following did {{respondent.ru_name}} invest in for the purposes of current or future innovation?

answers.description: Round to the nearest thousand pounds, for example enter £1,702,800 as 1703000
answers.label: Total acquisition of advanced machinery, equipment and software

content.title: Include:
list: Internal costs and purchase from outside the business

questions.title: Please estimate the amount of expenditure for the total acquisition of advanced machinery, equipment and software for the calendar year 2016 only?

content.title: Include:
list: Purchase or licensing of patents and non-patented inventions, know-how and other types of knowledge from other businesses or organisations

questions.title: Did {{respondent.ru_name}} invest in the acquisition of existing knowledge for the purposes of current or future innovation?

answers.description: Round to the nearest thousand pounds, for example enter £1,702,800 as 1703000
answers.label: Total acquisition of existing knowledge

content.title: Include:
list: Internal costs and purchase from outside {{respondent.ru_name}}

questions.title: Please estimate the amount of expenditure for acquisition of existing knowledge for the calendar year 2016 only?

content.title: Include:
list: Internal or external training for your personnel, specifically for the development or implementation of new or improved goods, services and processes.

questions.title: Did {{respondent.ru_name}} invest in training for innovative activities for the purposes of current or future innovation?

answers.description: Round to the nearest thousand pounds, for example enter £1,702,800 as 1703000
answers.label: Total training for innovative activities

content.title: Include:
list: Internal costs and purchase from outside the business

questions.title: Please estimate the amount of expenditure for training for innovative activities for the calendar year 2016 only?

content.title: Include:
list: Engagement in all design activities, including strategic, for the development or implementation of new or improved goods, services and processes.

questions.title: Did {{respondent.ru_name}} invest in all forms of design for the purposes of current or future innovation?

answers.description: Round to the nearest thousand pounds, for example enter £1,702,800 as 1703000
answers.label: Total training for all forms of design

content.title: Include:
list: Internal costs and purchase from outside the business

questions.title: Please estimate the amount of expenditure for all forms of design for the calendar year 2016 only?

options.value: Changes to product or service design

answers.description: Round to the nearest thousand pounds, for example enter £1,702,800 as 1703000
answers.label: Total market introduction of innovations

content.title: Include:
list: Internal costs and purchase from outside the business

questions.title: Please estimate the amount of expenditure for market introduction of innovations for the calendar year 2016 only?

blocks.title: Innovation Investment
blocks.description:
You have successfully completed this section

The next section covers innovation relating to goods and services.

You will first be asked to provide information about any new or significantly improved goods introduced by your business; and second to provide information relating to any new or significantly improved services.

You will also be asked to provide estimates for turnover in the calendar year 2016 relating to new or improved goods or services introduced during the period 1 January 2014 to 31 December 2016.

content.title: Include:
list: all new or significantly improved goods (for example, improvement in quality or distinct user benefits)
goods innovations that are new to the business, even if they are not new to the market
all product innovations, regardless of their origin

content.title: Exclude:
list: the simple resale of goods purchased from other businesses and changes of a solely aesthetic nature

questions.title: Did {{respondent.ru_name}} introduce new or significantly improved goods?

options.label: This business with other businesses or organisations
options.value: This business with other businesses or organisations

questions.title: Which entity mainly developed these goods?

content.title: Include:
list: all new or significantly improved services (for example, improvement in quality or distinct user benefits)
services innovations that are new to the business, even if they are not new to the market

questions.title: Did {{respondent.ru_name}} introduce new or significantly improved services?

options.label: This business with other businesses or organisations
options.value: This business with other businesses or organisations

questions.title: Which entity mainly developed these services?

content.title: Include:
list: Goods or services this business introduced to the market before competitors

questions.title: Were any of your goods and services innovations new to the market?

content.title: Include:
list: New goods or services that were essentially the same as a good or service already available from competitors

questions.title: Were any of your goods and services innovations only new to {{respondent.ru_name}}?

blocks.description:
The following question refers to turnover for the calendar year 1st January to 31st December 2016, based on goods or services introduced during the period 1st January 2014 to 31st December 2016.

If {{respondent.ru_name}} did not introduce any new or significantly improved goods or services, please enter 100% in the ‘Unchanged or only marginally modified’ answer field.

Please note that estimates are acceptable and percentages must total 100%.

list: The market sales of goods and services (including all taxes except VAT)

The next section covers innovation relating to processes for the production or supply of goods or services including all new or significantly improved methods of production.

You will be asked to provide general information about process innovation for your business.

content.title: Include:

process innovations that are new to {{respondent.ru_name}}, even if they are not new to your industry
all process innovations, regardless of their origin

blocks.title: Constraints on Innovation
blocks.description:
You have successfully completed this section

The next section covers factors affecting innovation. You will be asked to provide information on factors deemed important when deciding to initiate or terminate innovation.

Alternatively, if you have previously indicated that your business had no innovation activities, the next section will cover Public Financial Support for Innovation received from government.

In the Public Financial Support for Innovation section you will be asked to provide information specifying the type, if any, of public financial support your business received and the source; for example, Research & Development tax credits received from UK central government.

The next section covers Public Financial Support for Innovation received from government.

You will be asked to provide information specifying the type, if any, of public financial support your business received and the source; for example, Research & Development tax credits received from UK central government.

answers.description: Include UK government’s agencies or funding bodies. For example Innovate UK, formerly known as TSB
answers.label: UK central government

content.title: Include:
list: financial support via tax credits or deductions, grants, subsidised loans and loan guarantees

content.title: Exclude:
list: Research and Development and other innovations activities conducted entirely for the public sector under contract.

content.description: The public sector includes government owned organisations such as local, regional and national administrations and agencies, schools, hospitals and government providers of services such as security, transport, housing and energy

answers.description: For example Smart or Collaborative Research and Development grants, work with Catapult centres, Innovation vouchers

answers.description: For example Research and Development tax credits, Patent box

The next section section covers Turnover and Exports for your business. You will be asked to provide total turnover excluding VAT for calendar years 2014 and 2016 as well as an estimate of your business’s total value of exports for the calendar year 2016.

answers.description: Round to the nearest thousand pounds, for example enter £1,702,800 as 1703000

blocks.title: Turnover and Exports
blocks.description:

The next section covers information relating to persons employed by your business. You will be asked to provide estimates for the total number of employees for the calendar years 2014 and 2016, an estimate of the proportion of your workforce who hold a degree or higher qualification and information regarding the skills possessed by employees, for example, mathematics or statistics.

questions.title: Please estimate {{respondent.ru_name}}’s average number of employees for the calendar year 2014 only
Please estimate {{respondent.ru_name}}’s average number of employees for the calendar year 2016 only

The maximum value allowed is 100. Please correct your answer.

list: BA, BSc, MA, PhD, PGCE

options.label: Multimedia, web design (for example audio, graphics, text, still pictures, animation, video)
options.value: Multimedia, web design (for example audio, graphics, text, still pictures, animation, video)

blocks.description:
You have successfully completed this section

The next section covers General Information about this survey.

questions.title: Please write any additional comments you would like to make on the information you have provided.

content.title: Include:
list: Any time spent extracting information from your accounting systems and collating data over and above normal accounting operations

questions.title: How long has it taken you to complete this questionnaire?

Would {{respondent.ru_name}} be willing to be approached by telephone by the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy or its appointed agents, to ask some further questions about innovation?
Submission

list: You will not be able to access or change your answers on submitting the questionnaire
If you wish to review your answers please select the relevant completed sections

blocks.title: You are now ready to submit this survey
